00025 #include "syx-memory.h"
00026 #include "syx-platform.h"
00027 #include "syx-config.h"
00028 #include "syx-error.h"
00029 #include "syx-interp.h"
00030 #include "syx-types.h"
00031 #include "syx-object.h"
00032 
00033 #include <assert.h>
00034 
00035 static SyxErrorEntry *_syx_error_entries = NULL;
00036 static SyxErrorType _syx_error_entries_top = 0;
00037 
00038 #ifndef HAVE_ERRNO_H
00039 int errno=0;
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 #define REGISTER_SIGNAL(class, desc, value) \
00043   (assert (syx_error_register (desc, syx_globals_at (class)) == value))
00044 
00051 void
00052 syx_error_init (void)
00053 {
00054   _syx_error_entries_top = 0;
00055   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("VMError", "Interpreter internal fail", SYX_ERROR_INTERP);
00056   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("NotFound", "Not found", SYX_ERROR_NOT_FOUND);
00057   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("WrongArgumentCount", "Wrong number of arguments", SYX_ERROR_WRONG_ARGUMENT_COUNT);
00058 
00059   /* System signals */
00060   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("UserInterrupt", "User interrupt", SYX_ERROR_USER_INTERRUPT);
00061   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("FloatingPointException", "Floating point exception", SYX_ERROR_FLOATING_POINT_EXCEPTION);
00062   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("TerminationSignal", "Received TERM signal", SYX_ERROR_TERMINATION);
00063   REGISTER_SIGNAL ("AbnormalTermination", "Abort requested", SYX_ERROR_ABORT);
00064 }
00065 
00073 void
00074 syx_error_clear (void)
00075 {
00076   syx_free (_syx_error_entries);
00077 }
00078 
00086 SyxErrorType
00087 syx_error_register (syx_symbol name, SyxOop klass)
00088 {
00089   SyxErrorEntry *entry;
00090   if (!_syx_error_entries)
00091     _syx_error_entries = (SyxErrorEntry *)syx_calloc (++_syx_error_entries_top, sizeof (SyxErrorEntry));
00092   else
00093     _syx_error_entries = (SyxErrorEntry *)syx_realloc (_syx_error_entries,
00094                                                        (++_syx_error_entries_top) * sizeof (SyxErrorEntry));
00095 
00096   entry = &_syx_error_entries[_syx_error_entries_top - 1];
00097   entry->name = name;
00098   entry->klass = klass;
00099 
00100   return _syx_error_entries_top - 1;
00101 }
00102 
00109 SyxErrorEntry *
00110 syx_error_lookup (SyxErrorType type)
00111 {
00112   if (type >= _syx_error_entries_top)
00113     return NULL;
00114 
00115   return &_syx_error_entries[type];
00116 }
00117 
00124 syx_bool
00125 syx_signal (SyxErrorType type, SyxOop message)
00126 {
00127   SyxOop context;
00128   SyxErrorEntry *entry;
00129   
00130   entry = syx_error_lookup (type);
00131   if (!entry)
00132     return FALSE;
00133 
00134   if (!syx_system_initialized)
00135     {
00136       if (SYX_OBJECT_IS_STRING (message) || SYX_OBJECT_IS_SYMBOL (message))
00137         syx_error ("%s: %s\n", entry->name, SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (message));
00138       else
00139         syx_error (entry->name);
00140     }
00141 
00142   if (SYX_IS_NIL (message))
00143     context = syx_send_unary_message (entry->klass, "signal");
00144   else
00145     context = syx_send_binary_message (entry->klass, "signal:", message);
00146 
00147   /* Create a blocking context into another process for system signals, because it's not related
00148      to any specific process. */
00149   if (type >= SYX_ERROR_SYSTEM)
00150     {
00151       SyxOop process = syx_process_new ();
00152       syx_interp_enter_context (process, context);
00153       syx_process_execute_blocking (process);
00154     }
00155   else
00156     syx_interp_enter_context (syx_processor_active_process, context);
00157 
00158   return TRUE;
00159 }
00160 
00166 SyxOop
00167 syx_signal_create_context (SyxErrorType type, SyxOop message)
00168 {
00169   SyxOop context;
00170   SyxErrorEntry *entry;
00171   
00172   entry = syx_error_lookup (type);
00173   if (!entry)
00174     return syx_nil;
00175 
00176   if (SYX_IS_NIL (message))
00177     context = syx_send_unary_message (entry->klass, "signal");
00178   else
00179     context = syx_send_binary_message (entry->klass, "signal:", message);
00180 
00181   return context;
00182 }
00183 
00190 syx_bool
00191 syx_signal_does_not_understand(SyxOop receiver, SyxOop selector)
00192 {
00193   return syx_interp_enter_context (syx_processor_active_process,
00194                                    syx_send_binary_message (receiver,
00195                                                             "doesNotUnderstand:",
00196                                                             selector));
00197 }
00198 
00204 #ifndef WINCE
00205 void
00206 syx_error (syx_symbol fmt, ...)
00207 {
00208   va_list ap;
00209   fprintf (stderr, "ERROR: ");
00210   va_start (ap, fmt);
00211   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
00212   va_end (ap);
00213   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00214   exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00215 }
00216 #else /* !WINCE */
00217 void
00218 syx_error (syx_symbol fmt, ...)
00219 {
00220   MessageBox (0, SYX_IFDEF_UNICODE (fmt), "Error", 0);
00221   exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00222 }
00223 #endif /* WINCE */
00224 
00226 void
00227 syx_warning (syx_symbol fmt, ...)
00228 {
00229   va_list ap;
00230   fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: ");       
00231   va_start (ap, fmt);
00232   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
00233   va_end (ap);
00234 }
00235 
00237 void
00238 syx_perror (syx_symbol message)
00239 {
00240 #ifdef HAVE_PERROR
00241   perror (message);
00242 #else
00243   fputs (message, stderr);
00244 #endif
00245 
00246   exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00247 }
